t: Matthew 8
When*p he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.
And,*p behold, there came a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
And*p Jesus put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I*r will;*r be*r thou*r clean.*r And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

And*p Jesus saith unto him, See*r thou*r tell*r no*r man;*r but*r go*r thy*r way,*r shew*r thyself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r the*r gift*r that*r Moses*r commanded,*r for*r a*r testimony*r unto*r them.*r
And*p when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,
And*p saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.
And*p Jesus saith unto him, I*r will*r come*r and*r heal*r him.*r
The*p centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.
For*p I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this man, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
When*p Jesus heard it, he marvelled, and said to them that followed, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r so*r great*r faith,*r no,*r not*r in*r Israel.*r

And*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r many*r shall*r come*r from*r the*r east*r and*r west,*r and*r shall*r sit*r down*r with*r Abraham,*r and*r Isaac,*r and*r Jacob,*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r
But*rp the*r children*r of*r the*r kingdom*r shall*r be*r cast*r out*r into*r outer*r darkness:*r there*r shall*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.*r
And*p Jesus said unto the centurion, Go*r thy*r way;*r and*r as*r thou*r hast*r believed,*r so*r be*r it*r done*r unto*r thee.*r And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour.
And*p when Jesus was come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother laid, and sick of a fever.
And*p he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.
When*p the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with his word, and healed all that were sick:
That*p it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bare our sicknesses.
Now*p when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.
And*p a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
And*p Jesus saith unto him, The*r foxes*r have*r holes,*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r have*r nests;*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r hath*r not*r where*r to*r lay*r his*r head.*r
And*p another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
But*p Jesus said unto him, Follow*r me;*r and*r let*r the*r dead*r bury*r their*r dead.*r
And*p when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.
And,*p behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.
And*p his disciples came to him, and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.
And*p he saith unto them, Why*r are*r ye*r fearful,*r O*r ye*r of*r little*r faith?*r Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
But*p the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!
And*p when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.
And,*p behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God? art thou come hither to torment us before the time?
And*p there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.
So*p the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.

And*p he said unto them, Go.*r And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.
And*p they that kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told every thing, and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils.
And,*p behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts.
